Job Title: Analyst | Associate, Underwriter (Direct Lending) - CHI / NY / DSM

Location: Des Moines, IA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
What You'll Do

Principal Alternative Credit (Direct Lending) launched in 2020 and our team is growing! Our success depends on the unique experiences, backgrounds, and talents of our employees – individually and all of us together. The Direct Lending team has a growth mindset that believes in developing the talents of all our employees. We welcome fresh perspectives and are looking for someone with the skills, work ethic and positive attitude to inspire change and help us through our next phase of growth. You will gain a ton of meaningful experience with a team that’s invested in your personal success.

We’ll help you build a successful career through:

Coaching from senior team members who are invested in your successPromoting training and development opportunities that help you build new skills or take on additional responsibilityProviding resources and technology to help you work smarter, not harderProviding you opportunities to volunteer, attend targeted networking events and through strategic introductions to expand your network inside and outside of Principal


Responsibilities:

As an Analyst / Associate, you’ll assist in the due diligence, credit underwriting, execution, and portfolio monitoring of private debt investments.

Areas of focus include, but not limited to: 

Conduct due diligence including company & industry research, cash flow modeling, financial and dataroom analysis to determine the creditworthiness of prospective borrowersAssist in the preparation of credit memos and present the underwriting results and recommendations to an investment committeeInteract with various stakeholders, including equity sponsors, company management teams (c-suite), investment bankers, sponsor coverage, credit professionals, legal counsels and operations personnelMonitor the performance of portfolio companies, including on-going compliance with credit agreements and internal policiesEnsure portfolio data is accurate, timely, and complete to ensure strong quality and reporting capabilities


Additional Responsibilities may include:

Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and managers to resolve issues as they arise and achieve goalsParticipate in internal initiatives to ensure the business is well-managed and operates efficiently


Who You Are

Analyst Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or a related field (minimum of 3.50 GPA)Ability to analyze and interpret financial statements, evaluate large sets of data and formulate conclusions. Has familiarity with leveraged buyout modelingDemonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skillsStrong, clear and concise written and oral communication skillsStrong attention to detail and accuracy skillsStrong organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skillsAbility to work effectively independently and in a team environmentHighly motivated and intellectually curious and open-minded individualsProficient in Excel, Microsoft Word and PowerPoint


Associate Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or a related field (minimum of 3.50 GPA)1+ years’ experience within leveraged finance, private debt and/or related transactional experience.Knowledge of financial markets and fixed income strategies, including general knowledge of bond mechanics and pricing calculations is preferred. Ability to construct financial models such as three statement financial models and leveraged buyout models.Highly motivated and intellectually curious and open-minded individuals.Strong financial modeling, valuation and accounting skills.Collaborative, able to build and maintain strong relationships, manage expectations, attend to details, multi-task and prioritize effectively


Salary Range Information

Salary ranges below reflect targeted base salaries. Non-sales positions have the opportunity to participate in a bonus program. Sales positions are eligible for sales incentives, and in some instances a bonus plan, whereby total compensation may far exceed base salary depending on individual performance. Actual compensation for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer.

Salary Range (Non-Exempt expressed as hourly; Exempt expressed as yearly)

$86450 - $167000 / year

Time Off Program

Flexible Time Off (FTO) is provided to salaried (exempt) employees and provides the opportunity to take time away from the office with pay for vacation, personal or short-term illness. Employees don’t accrue a bank of time off under FTO and there is no set number of days provided.

Pension Eligible

No

Additional Information

Location

We’re open to considering talent in the Chicago, Des Moines and New York area.

Work Environments

This role offers the ability for in-office or four days in-office and one day remote. You’ll work with your leader to figure out which option may align best based on several factors.

Work Authorization/Sponsorship

At this time, we're not considering candidates that need any type of immigration sponsorship (additional work authorization or permanent work authorization) now or in the future to work in the United States? This includes, but IS NOT LIMITED TO: F1-OPT, F1-CPT, H-1B, TN, L-1, J-1, etc. For additional information around work authorization needs please use the following links.

https://www.uscis.gov/working-in-the-united-states/temporary-nonimmigrant-workers and https://www.uscis.gov/green-card/green-card-eligibility/green-card-for-employment-based-immigrants

Investment Code of Ethics

For Principal Global Investors positions, you’ll need to follow an Investment Code of Ethics related to personal and business conduct as well as personal trading activities for you and members of your household. These same requirements may also apply to other positions across the organization.

Experience Principal

While our expertise spans the globe, we're bound by one common purpose: to foster a world where financial security is accessible to all. And our success depends on the unique experiences, backgrounds, and talents of our employees – individually and all of us together. Explore our core values, benefits and why we’re an exceptional place to grow your career.

Principal is an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Posting Window

We will accept applications for 3 full days following the Original Posting Date, after which the posting may remain open or be removed based upon applications received. If we choose to post the job again, we will accept additional applications for at least 1 full day following the Most Recently Posted Date. Please submit applications in a timely manner as there is no guarantee the posting will be available beyond the applicable deadline.

Original Posting Date

4/8/2024

Most Recently Posted Date

4/5/2024

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
